alert.note: Alert for Lower Koyukuk and Middle Yukon Valleys (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued December 17 at 1:06PM AKST until December 18 at 12:00PM AKST by NWS Fairbanks
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL NOON AKST SATURDAY... ...WINTER STORM WATCH IN EFFECT FROM LATE SATURDAY NIGHT THROUGH SUNDAY EVENING... * WHAT...Snow occurring. Heavy snow, blowing snow, and Freezing Rain possible. Plan on difficult travel conditions. Additional snowfall through noon Saturday 2 to 4 inches. Snow expected Saturday night and Sunday with up to 8 inches accumulation. Freezing rain expected with ice accumulation one tenth inch possible. * WHERE...Lower Koyukuk and Middle Yukon Valleys. * WHEN...For the Winter Weather Advisory, until noon Saturday. For the Winter Storm Watch, from late Saturday night through Sunday evening. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Look for reduced visibilities at times. Winds gusting as high as 35 mph will cause areas of blowing and drifting snow. PRECAUTIONARY/PREPAREDNESS ACTIONS... A Winter Weather Advisory for snow means periods of snow will cause travel difficulties. A Winter Storm Watch means there is potential for significant snow, sleet or ice accumulations that may impact travel. Continue to monitor the latest forecasts.

area.areaDesc: Lower Koyukuk and Middle Yukon Valleys
